title: Open Channel Management - CrossSection
description: This entity contains a harmonised description of a generic cross-section made for Open Channel Management (raw-water systems). CrossSection defines any point of the system where water-related properties are monitored or computed.

attachedTo.description: Relationship. Model:'../Channel/schema.json'. A relationship to the ID of the channel where the cross-section 'lives in'. Reference to an entity of type Channel

allOf.description: Property. The distance between this CrossSection and a reference point (e.g., the most upstream point of the system)
Relationship. The reference point distance is count from

waterFlow.description: Property. Rate of water flow in the cross-section

waterTemperature.description: Property. Quality parameter (temperature) in the cross-section

turbidity.description: Property. Quality parameter (turbidity) in the cross-section

specificConductivity.description: Property. Quality parameter (conductivity) in the cross-section

waterLevel.description: Property. Water level in the cross-section

energyHead.description: Property. The energy head in the cross-section

CrossSectionGeometry.description: Property. Description of the geometry of a cross-section. Text defining the geometry of a CrossSection. Enum:'Trapezoidal, Circular'.

bottomSlope.description: Property. The bottom slope of the channel in the case of 'Trapezoidal' type. All units are accepted in CEFACT code

leftSideSlope.description: Property. The slope of the left bank of the channel in the case of 'Trapezoidal' type. All units are accepted in CEFACT code

rightSideSlope.description: Property. The slope of the right bank of the channel in the case of 'Trapezoidal' type. All units are accepted in CEFACT code

bottomWidth.description: Property. The bottom width of the channel in the case of 'Trapezoidal' type. All units are accepted in CEFACT code

diameter.description: Property. The diameter of a circular channel

maxWaterDepth.description: Property. The maximum allowable water depth of the channel. All units are accepted in CEFACT code

copiesFrom.description: Relationship. URI of a Channel component from which the value of a property is obtained
